intro: Bactris escragnollei, commonly known as the pink pineapple, is a member of the Arecaceae family and is native to Central and South America. It is a tall, slender palm that can grow up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its large, curved leaves and distinctive pinkish-red fruit. The plant produces edible berries that are rich in nutrients and often used in local cuisines. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping and horticultural purposes. Bactris escragnollei thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
